author: Les LaMotte

comments.message: Les, this seems similar to your other post on the use of AsepticSure. What are your ideas for how this idea could be promoted? How expensive is this technology? It looks like a big machine so I'm wondering about portability. https://openideo.com/challenge/fighting-ebola/ideas/portable-soft-walled-shelters-with-asepticsure-technology-underway-for-the-fight-against-ebola

Yes Michelle it is the same technology as in Les's original post.  I think this was meant to be add on information to the original post that showed our media coverage with the demo we conducted a few weeks ago.  To answer your question, the entire field hospital is fully portable - it was specifically designed that way.  Every piece of kit has been field tested for portability.  Design Shelter has extensive experience in remote field applications and with the addition of the AsepticSure technology, we add one more piece of kit to our already impressive portable field hospital solution.  What is offered now is a fully reusable system because AsepticSure completely disinfects the portable shelters themselves plus all equipment left inside. Please see my response to your original comment on the cost.  I'll allow Les to comment on his thoughts regarding promotion but my opinion is to simply help to create awareness of the solution that we are able to offer now and to help find us a mandate to pilot the solution in a real world situation.  We have 100% confidence that permitted to demonstrate this solution in a real world event, the solution could become the de facto standard for reusable field medical facilities for any type of viral epidemic or pandemic.
